questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a ventilation mode offered by the Respironics V60 Ventilator?
questions.info: The V60 Ventilator offers CPAP, S/T, PCV, and AVAPS modes, but does not have a VCV (Volume Control Ventilation) mode.

questions.question: What should you do if any of the preoperational checks fail before using the V60 Ventilator on a patient?
questions.info: If any preoperational tests fail, the ventilator should not be used on a patient until it is serviced to ensure safe and proper functioning.

options.option: Proceed with using the ventilator but monitor closely
Do not use the ventilator until it is serviced
Restart the ventilator and rerun the checks

questions.question: Which of the following is a high priority alarm on the V60 Ventilator?
questions.info: A Patient Circuit Disconnect alarm is a high priority alarm on the V60 Ventilator because it signals a condition that may severely compromise ventilation and requires immediate response.

questions.question: How often should the cooling fan filter on the V60 Ventilator be inspected for dust and debris?
questions.info: The cooling fan filter on the back of the V60 Ventilator should be inspected monthly for dust and debris accumulation and cleaned or replaced if needed.

questions.question: Which of the following parameters is NOT directly set by the clinician in AVAPS mode on the V60 Ventilator?
questions.info: In AVAPS mode, the V60 automatically adjusts pressure support within set Min/Max limits to achieve a target tidal volume. The clinician does not directly set the pressure support level.
